meta_description: The CJM makes the diversity of the Jewish experience relevant for a twenty-first century audience. We accomplish this through innovative exhibitions and programs that educate, challenge, and inspire.
accessibility_text:
ACCESSIBILITY

ACCESSIBILITY

Free and Reduced Admission

The CJM offers several discounted and free admission opportunities in an effort to lower financial barriers and to expand accessibility for low-income and under-resourced communities. 

## **Museums for All**

Free admission for EBT (Electronic Benefit Transfer), SNAP (Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program), CalFresh, and Medi-Cal cardholders and their families through the [Museums for All](https://museums4all.org/about/) program. 

## **Blue Star Museum**

Year-round free admission for veterans, active military personnel, and their families.

## **Discover & Go Library Program**

The CJM is part of the Discover & Go program, which provides free admission for all California library cardholders. Free passes to The CJM can be found online from your library's website.

## **CAPP**

Free year-round admission and guided tours for [Community Access Partnership Program](https://thecjm.org/programs/84) members—an annual low-cost membership for social service agencies, transition-age youth programs, and community-based nonprofits that serve communities who experience significant barriers to the arts. 

## Youth 18 and under, and transition-age youth (TAY) (18–26) receive free admission.
collections_text: **THE CJM IS[TEMPORARILY CLOSED](https://www.thecjm.org/pages/621). [SUPPORT US](https://www.thecjm.org/donate) DURING OUR TRANSITION, [SIGN UP FOR UPDATES](http://eepurl.com/QLzIn), OR [RENT THE MUSEUM FOR YOUR EVENT](https://www.thecjm.org/rent_the_museum)**
